markdown:
<title level="1" right="Spell 4" pfs="Standard">[Speak with Plants](/Spells.aspx?ID=294)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Divination" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=47" />
<trait label="Plant" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=125" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 370 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

**Tradition**
[Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

**Deities**
[Arundhat](/Deities.aspx?ID=186), [Arundhat](/Deities.aspx?ID=186), [Halcamora](/Deities.aspx?ID=120), [Hearth and Harvest](/Deities.aspx?ID=252), [Matravash](/Deities.aspx?ID=193), [Yuelral](/Deities.aspx?ID=111)

<row gap="medium">

<row gap="tiny">
<row>**Cast**</row>
<row><actions string="Two Actions" /></row>
<row>[somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)</row>
</row>

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 10 minutes
</row>

</column>

---

You can ask questions of and receive answers from plants and fungi, but the spell doesn't make them more friendly or intelligent than normal. Most normal plants and fungi have a distinctive view of the world around them, so they don't recognize details about creatures or know anything about the world beyond their immediate vicinity. Cunning plant or fungus monsters are likely to be terse and evasive, while less intelligent ones often make inane comments.
name: Speak with Plants

<summary>

</summary>
summary: Communicate with plants and plant creatures.
summary_markdown: Communicate with plants and plant creatures.
text: Speak with Plants Source Core Rulebook pg. 370 4.0 Tradition Primal Deities Arundhat, Arundhat, Halcamora, Hearth and Harvest, Matravash, Yuelral Cast Two Actions somatic, verbal Duration 10 minutes --- You can ask questions of and receive answers from plants and fungi, but the spell doesn't make them more friendly or intelligent than normal. Most normal plants and fungi have a distinctive view of the world around them, so they don't recognize details about creatures or know anything about the world beyond their immediate vicinity. Cunning plant or fungus monsters are likely to be terse and evasive, while less intelligent ones often make inane comments.
